items.title: 'My best is yet to come' - Semenyo joins Man City in ¬£65m deal
items.summary: Manchester City sign Ghana international Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth in a deal worth about ¬£65m.

items.title: Excuses en mooi gebaar na belachelijk maken Congolese fan
items.summary: De huidige editie van de Afrika Cup kende tot dusver een verrassende hoofdrolspeler: Michel Kuka Mboladinga alias Lumumba. Dat is niet een voetballer, maar een supporter van DR Congo die bij elk duel van zijn land stokstijf stond gedurende de hele wedstrijd. Zijn verhaal werd nog groter toen hij belachelijk werd gemaakt door een tegenstander, maar de vrede is inmiddels getekend.

items.title: Manchester City legt dik 70 miljoen euro op tafel voor Semenyo
items.summary: De transfer hing al een tijdje in de lucht, maar is nu officieel beklonken. Antoine Semenyo maakt per direct de overstap naar Manchester City. Bournemouth ontvangt zo'n 75 miljoen euro voor de vleugelspeler.

items.title: Premier League-ster, maar als vijftienjarige gestopt: het verhaal van Semenyo
items.summary: Bournemouth deed afgelopen zomer drie grote uitgaande transfers en de volgende blikvanger staat alweer klaar. Antoine Semenyo (25) behoort tot de beste spelers van de Premier League. En exact tien jaar geleden voetbalde hij niet eens.

items.title: Man City confirms Semenyo signing in $84m deal
items.summary: Manchester City have announced the signing of Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth.

items.title: Xabi slams Simeone shouts at Vini: 'Didn't like it'
items.summary: Xabi Alonso slammed Diego Simeone for his clash with Vin√≠cius J√∫nior during Real Madrid's 2-1 Supercopa semifinal win over Atl√©tico Madrid on Thursday, saying "not anything goes."

items.title: Liverpool criticize Martinelli, fear for Bradley injury
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot said Gabriel Martinelli's push on an injured Conor Bradley in his side's 0-0 draw with Arsenal on Thursday "doesn't look great," adding that he feared for the extent of Bradley's injury.

items.title: Martinelli 'deeply sorry' for shoving injured Bradley
items.summary: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli revealed he reached out to Conor Bradley to apologize for shoving the badly injured Liverpool defender off the pitch late in Thursday's 0-0 draw

items.title: Taylor naar Lazio: 'Kan De Vrij-route bewandelen'
items.summary: Kenneth Taylor vertrekt van Ajax naar Lazio. In VI ZSM hebben Rob Aarts en Sjoerd Keizer het over deze stap en gaat het over de Lazio-interesse in Quinten Timber.

items.title: Why Man City have signed 'extraordinary' Semenyo
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo has gone from Bristol City to Man City in the space of three years. BBC Sport looks at why Pep Guardiola has moved for the Bournemouth man.

items.title: Manchester City sign Antoine Semenyo for initial ¬£62.5m on contract to 2031
items.summary: Deal with Bournemouth has add-ons and sell-on clause Semenyo says he is aiming to get City into the title race Antoine Semenyo says he has arrived at Manchester City with the intention of getting the club back into the Premier League title race. The ¬£62.5m signing joins a team six points behind the leaders, Arsenal, with 17 matches remaining. The 26-year-old‚Äôs transfer from Bournemouth, who could receive ¬£1.5m in add-ons and are due 10% of any future profit, was confirmed on Friday and Semenyo could make his debut against Exeter in the FA Cup on Saturday. City fought off competition from Liverpool and Manchester United to secure his signature. Continue reading...

items.title: Tiende plaats past Spartanen als een jas
items.summary: Op een paar uitzonderingen na die juist net in een flow waren geraakt, haalden de Eredivisie-clubs op het tandvlees de winterstop. Veel tijd om weer op adem te komen, hebben ze alleen niet, want dit weekeinde begint het hele circus alweer. In aanloop naar het cruciale deel van het seizoen maken we bij elke club de balans op, waarbij we wat de volgorde betreft uitgaan van de eerste speelronde van 2026. Deze keer: middenmoter Sparta Rotterdam.

items.title: 'If you're outside the top six, you can never target an FA Cup run'
items.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why the FA Cup has fallen down the pecking order for managers, despite still being a special competition.

items.title: Arsenal still in control of title race; Liverpool show they need to improve
items.summary: Both Arsenal and Liverpool settled for a point in a scoreless draw, but it was a missed opportunity for the Gunners to extend their lead in the Premier League.

items.title: Ref Watch LIVE! Did Martinelli receive correct punishment for push on Bradley?
Victor Osimhen‚Äôs volatile temperament risks harming Nigeria‚Äôs Afcon quest
items.summary: Talismanic forward‚Äôs spat with teammate Ademola Lookman highlights the problematic behaviour threatening to overshadow his talent Victor Osimhen is the talisman, the attacking arrowhead of Nigeria‚Äôs Super Eagles at the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco, his three goals offering a warning to Algeria before Saturday‚Äôs quarter-final. But the focus on the 27 year old this week has fallen less on his talent and more on his behaviour. Osimhen‚Äôs volatile temperament, displayed in a spat with his teammate Ademola Lookman during Monday‚Äôs 4-0 win against Mozambique, has grabbed the headlines. The Galatasaray striker scored twice to underline his world-class finishing but that has been rendered almost an afterthought. Continue reading...

items.title: Kartal misses huge chance to beat top seed Svitolina and reach Auckland semis
items.summary: Britain's Sonay Kartal missed out on a huge chance to knock out top seed Elina Svitolina and reach the semi-finals of the ASB Classic, eventually losing 6-4 6-7 (2) 7-6 (5).

items.title: Keep McCullum? Cook as assistant? - Questions for England after Ashes defeat
items.summary: With England left to lick their wounds after yet another Ashes drubbing in Australia, we look at the most pressing questions facing the team as they address the fallout from their 4-1 series defeat...
